com.echsylon.atlantis

Class MockResponse.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.echsylon.atlantis.MockResponse.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    MockResponse

    public static final class MockResponse.Builder
extends Object
    This class offers means of building a mocked response configuration directly from code (as opposed to configure one in a JSON file).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Builder()
      Creates a new builder based on an empty mock response object.
      Builder(MockResponse source)
      Creates a new builder based on the provided mock response object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      MockResponse.Builder addHeader(String key, String value)
      Adds a header to the mock response being built.
      MockResponse.Builder addHeaders(Map<String,List<String>> headers)
      Adds all non-empty header keys and values to the mock response being built.
      MockResponse.Builder addHeaders(String key, List<String> values)
      Adds all non-empty header keys and values to the mock response being built.
      MockResponse.Builder addHeaders(String key, String... values)
      Adds all non-empty header keys and values to the mock response being built.
      MockResponse.Builder addSetting(String key, String value)
      Deprecated. 
      Use setSetting(String, String) instead. Planned to be removed in Atlantis 3.0
      MockResponse.Builder addSettings(Map<String,String> settings)
      Deprecated. 
      Use setSettings(Map) instead. Planned to be removed in Atlantis 3.0
      MockResponse build()
      Returns a sealed mock response object which can not be further built on.
      MockResponse.Builder setBody(byte[] bytes)
      Sets a byte array as the body content fo the mock response being built.
      MockResponse.Builder setBody(String string)
      Sets a string as the body content of the mock response being built.
      MockResponse.Builder setHeader(String key, String value)
      Adds a header to the mock response being build, replacing any and all existing values for the same key.
      MockResponse.Builder setSetting(String key, String value)
      Adds a setting to the mock response being built.
      MockResponse.Builder setSettings(Map<String,String> settings)
      Adds all non-empty settings to the mock response being built.
      MockResponse.Builder setStatus(int code, String phrase)
      Sets the status of the mock response being built.

      • addSetting

        public MockResponse.Builder addSetting(String key,
                                       String value)
        Deprecated. Use setSetting(String, String) instead. Planned to be removed in Atlantis 3.0
        Adds a setting to the mock response being built. Any existing value with the same key will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        key - The setting key.
        value - The setting value.
        Returns:
        This builder instance, allowing chaining of method calls.

      • addSettings

        Deprecated. Use setSettings(Map) instead. Planned to be removed in Atlantis 3.0
        Adds all non-empty settings to the mock response being built. Any existing values with the same keys will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        settings - The settings to add.
        Returns:
        This builder instance, allowing chaining of method calls.

      • setStatus

        public MockResponse.Builder setStatus(int code,
                                      String phrase)
        Sets the status of the mock response being built. Doesn't validate neither the given status code nor the phrase. It's up to the caller to ensure they match and make sense in the given context.
        Parameters:
        code - The new HTTP status code.
        phrase - The corresponding human readable status text (e.g. "OK", "Not found", etc).
        Returns:
        This builder instance, allowing chaining of method calls.

      • setBody

      • build

        public MockResponse build()
        Returns a sealed mock response object which can not be further built on.
        Returns:
        The final mock response object.
